serverURL.description: The URL to the open bi Repository installation that handles the export. If you use an installation on your local machine, change this property to http://localhost:9091, otherwise to the address and port of your installation.

licenseKey.description: The license key to be used for sending the notification (for usage tracking, usage limits, special smtp server configuration)

filename.description: The file name of the export document. The extension will be determined automatically. You can use placeholders (manual section 3.9).

exportLanguage.description: By default, the export determines the language for the export document from the web client. The export language is used to render the correct format for date and time placeholders (manual section 3.10) and to interpret number formats correctly for Excel export (manual secion 3.11).  You can set this property explicitly to overrule the automatic determination.

screenWidth.description: By default the export uses the screen width of the user to create an export document that resembles the screen display. If you experience extensive white spaces or to small font sizes, you can set this property to a static value, e.g. 1000 pixels.

screenHeight.description: If you make extensive use of relative height definitions, exports to PowerPoint, Word or Excel might show to small font sizes. In this case, you can set this property to a static value, e.g. 800 pixels. You might have to combine with a Static Screen Width.

parseCss.description: If the Export does not show icons or images, you can set this property to true. This activates the collection of all images of the SAC application and sends them to the Export service.

biAnalyticsDocument.description: If set to true, the export automatically creates native Office objects when possible - charts, tables, dropdowns, texts etc.

pdfTemplate.description: As an alternative to the HTML Template property, you can also specify a DOC, DOCX, PPT or PPTX template which will be used as a fully formatted template for your PDF export

pptSeparate.description: This property only takes affect if you are not using an Export Template. If set to `false` the application is rendered onto one slide. If you set this property to `true`, each component is rendered to a separate slide.

pptTemplate.description: By specifying a template for the PowerPoint Export (in PPT or PPTX formats) you can generate complete presentations in your corporate design and with standard text

docTemplate.description: By specifying a template for the Word Export (in DOC or DOCX formats) you can generate complete Word documents in your corporate design and with standard text

xlsTemplate.description: By specifying a template for the Excel Export (in XLS or XLSX formats) you can generate complete Word documents in your corporate design and with standard text

publishMode.description: Controls the way the Export document is delivered: ONLINE, MAIL, FILE etc.

publishSync.description: If set to true, the export process runs synchronuously even if the file shall not be returned to the user.

mailFrom.description: The sender of the mail (Publish Mode must be set to MAIL)

mailTo.description: The recipients of the mail (Publish Mode must be set to MAIL)

mailSubject.description: The subject of the mail (Publish Mode must be set to MAIL)

mailBody.description: The mail body (Publish Mode must be set to MAIL)

showIcons.description: Show icons in the export buttons

showTexts.description: Show texts in the export buttons

pdfHeader.default: SAC Export

tablesSelectedWidgets.description: Selected Widgets for Meta Data / Result Set Retrieve

getParseCss.description: Get whether Parse CSS is enabled or not

setParseCss.description: Set whether Parse CSS is enabled or not

getBiAnalyticsDocument.description: Get whether biAnalytics Document is enabled or not

setBiAnalyticsDocument.description: Set whether biAnaltics Document is enabled or not

getPptSeparateSlides.description: Gets the Property 'One Component by Slide' for PowerPoint Export

setPptSeparateSlides.description: Sets the Property 'One Component by Slide' for PowerPoint Export.

getButtonIconVisible.description: Get the visibility of the button icon

setButtonIconVisible.description: Set the visibility of the button text

getButtonTextVisible.description: Get the visibility of the button text

setButtonTextVisible.description: Set the visibility of the button text

getViewSelectorVisible.description: Get the visibility of the view selector

setViewSelectorVisible.description: Set the visibility of the view selector

getWidgetSelectorVisible.description: Get the visibility of the widget selector

setWidgetSelectorVisible.description: Set the visibility of the widget selector

getPdfButtonVisible.description: Get the visibility of the PDF export button

setPdfButtonVisible.description: Set the visibility of the PDF export button

getPptButtonVisible.description: Get the visibility of the PowerPoint export button

setPptButtonVisible.description: Set the visibility of the PowerPoint export button

getDocButtonVisible.description: Get the visibility of the Word export button

setDocButtonVisible.description: Set the visibility of the Word export button

getXlsButtonVisible.description: Get the visibility of the Excel export button

setXlsButtonVisible.description: Set the visibility of the Excel export button

getPngButtonVisible.description: Get the visibility of the Images export button

setPngButtonVisible.description: Set the visibility of the Images export button

getCsvButtonVisible.description: Get the visibility of the CSV export button

setCsvButtonVisible.description: Set the visibility of the CSV export button

addSelectedWidget.description: Add a widget to be exported.

parameters.name: isSelected
parameters.description: Set to true to select, set to false to exclude

clearSelectedWidgets.description: Clears all applications to be exported during background execution.

addCustomText.description: Add a Custom Text to replace a placeholder in the export.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The text to be displayed for the placeholder.

addExportApplication.description: Add an application to be exported during background execution.

clearExportApplications.description: Clears all applications to be exported during background execution.

addURLParameter.description: Add an URL parameter and value which is used during background execution.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the URL parameter.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: The values of the URL parameter.

parameters.name: iterative
parameters.description: Whether the URL parameter values should be iterated over.

parameters.name: applicationIds
parameters.description: The applications for which the URL parameter will be used, if empty the URL parameter is used for all applications.

clearURLParameters.description: Clears all URLs parameters which are used during background execution.

addPdfSection.description: Add a PDF Section as an Export Template.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the PDF Section. May be empty.

parameters.name: header
parameters.description: The page header for the PDF Section.

parameters.name: footer
parameters.description: The page footer for the PDF Section.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The page content for the PDF Section.

parameters.name: iterative
parameters.description: Whether the URL parameter values should be iterated over.

addBriefingBookDefinition.description: Add a Briefing Book Definition which is used during background execution.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The url parameters to be passed to the application in JSON notation {"name": "myUrlParameter", "value": "itsValue"}

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Optional:The filename to which the results of the application shall be added.

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: Optional: The Export Template which shall be used for this particular execution.

parameters.name: customTexts
parameters.description: The custom texts to be replaced in the Export Template for this particular execution {"name": "myPlaceholder", "value": "textToReplace"}

parameters.name: selectedWidgets
parameters.description: Optional: The widgets to be added into the export document.

parameters.name: applicationIds
parameters.description: Optional: The applications for which the URL parameter will be used.

clearBriefingBookDefinitions.description: Clears all Briefing Book Definitions which are used during background execution.

addExportTemplateSection.description: Add an Export Template Section dynamically for the given format.

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: Name of the Export Template that shall be used for this section

parameters.name: pageBreakAfter
parameters.description: If set to false, the Word document section will not be ended with a page break.

parameters.name: placeholderRedefinitions
parameters.description: List of specific placeholders that replace the generic placholders of the Export Template {"name": "genericPlaceholderName", "value": "specificPlaceholderName"}

parameters.name: placeholderValues
parameters.description: List of values that replace the placholders of the Export Template {"name": "placeholderName", "value": "myText"}

clearExportTemplateSections.description: Clears the Export Template Sections for the given format.

onStart.description: Specify the SAC Script that shall be triggered when the Export process is started. If you set the publishing property Parse CSS to true, all image resources are collected in this phase.

onSend.description: Specify the SAC Script that shall be triggered when the Export process sends the content to the Export service.

onReturn.description: Specify the SAC Script that shall be triggered when the Export process receives the generated document from the Export service.

onError.description: Specify the SAC Script that shall be triggered when an error is reported by the Export process.
